name: 邱家吉
objective: This course focus on investigating the problems of the geotechnical engineering. Major topics of Advanced Geotechnical Engineering (I) consist of (1) Soil behavior, (2) Seepage, compressibility and strength of soil, (3) Slope and foundation engineering, (4) Investigation of rock masses, (5) Behavior of rock masses, (6) Rock slope stability and tunneling, and (7) Geotechnical reliability analysis.
schedule:
Week 1 Introduction
Week 2 Notation, tensor, Mohr circle and elasticity
Week 3 Soil composition and soil behavior
Week 4 Seepage in soil
Week 5 Soil consolidation and compaction
Week 6 Strength of soil
Week 7 Slope stability and retaining wall
Week 8 Foundation engineering
Week 9 Midterm exam
Week 10 Outcrop investigation and rock classifications
Week 11 Properties of intact rock
Week 12 Discontinuities in rock
Week 13 Behavior of jointed rock masses
Week 14 In-situ stress and rock hydraulics
Week 15 Rock slope stability
Week 16 Tunneling and rock masses excavation
Week 17 Geotechnical reliability analysis
Week 18 Final exam
materials:
1. Braja M. Das (2002), Principles of Geotechnical Engineering
2. Braja M. Das (2007), Principles of Foundation Engineering
3. Goodman R.E. (1989), Introduction to Rock Mechanics
4. Hoek, E. and Brown, E.T. (1981), Underground Excavations in Rock
5. Hoek, E. and Bray J. W. (1996), Rock Slope Engineering
